comm: 128 kph. Nice delivery, starts it a little wider on a fuller than good length. Rohit leaves
first runs for Rohit. Paris drifts straight and Rohit chips him over square leg for a couple. Did not bother keeping it down.
131 kph. That one may not have seamed as much as Rohit expected. Full delivery on middle and off, Rohit looks to tuck to midwicket but gets a thick outside edge which rolls to third man
poor delivery. Dhawan is off with a flayed cut through point. Very short and very wide outside off
nice end. Good length outside off, a hint of away shape. Dhawan watchfully defends
fullish but very wide outside off, just inside the tramline. Rohit shoulders arms
drags his length back just a touch but the same line - very wide outside off. Rohit decides to let it go again
better from KR. Full, inviting the swing, and closer to off stump but left alone
137 kph. Full again, a fifth-stump line. Rohit looks to hit on the up to mid-off but inside-edges to square leg
132 kph. Slowly he has got his lines and lengths close to perfection. Back of  a length outside off, Rohit stays back to block
not much swing but Rohit is beaten. Full and wide outside off, Rohit leans forward to defend but doesn't get close enough as the ball goes past

goes after it does Dhawan and he gets it through. Pretty good shot actually. Got close enough and threw his hands at it, very full and wide from Paris. Dhawan creams it to the cover boundary. Good intent

and he has to go now. What a shame, that was quite a poor delivery. Short and wide outside off from Paris, Dhawan looks to caress a cut but the extra bounce of the wicket takes the outside edge of the bat to Wade. Paris' first ODI wicket.
nice ball. Shortish delivery outside off, shaped away. Kohli goes back to defend carefully
oh, that was close. Kohli gets his front foot across the line but Paris swings it into those pads. Kohli, though, is good enough to turn the ball to square leg
shot. Rather full outside off, Kohli times a drive with exemplary timing to mid-off
uppish but wide of point. Kohli goes after a full delivery outside off, but doesn't get close enough to the pitch. The cut just evades a diving point fielder
flies to the third man fence. Another poor delivery, short and wide from Richardson. Rohit stands tall and pummels a cut to the third man boundary. Uppish but wide of the fielder
nice and full but straight. Defended properly
superb shot again. full and wide outside off from Richardson, too full. Rohit drives and finds the gap through cover for three. pulled in just inside the massive boundary
back of a length on off, a hint of inward movement but blocked
shortish length on off, nurdled off his hips towards fine leg.
excellent shot yet again. Full on off, just a punchy drive with all timing races to mid-off
nicely played. Good length delivery, nipping back in towards Kohli. Nudged towards square leg
full and wide. Nice delivery. Left alone comfortably
135 kph, drifts down leg this time. A bit of swing but wide
129 kph. Full outside off, Rohit leans into a drive to push to wide mid-off for a quick run

edged but just short of slip. Beauty. Full but shaped away from Kohli who prods defensively at it. Gets thick outside edge which surprisingly falls short of Smith at a wide slip. Great variation from Paris
drifts on Kohli's pads now who tucks him to deep square leg.
comes back in to Rohit who blocks awkwardly
not a great delivery again. Short and wide asking to be it. Kohli chops a cut to extra cover
helped on its way to fine leg. Goes for a change in length, digs the ball in to the pitch.
whack. What a shot. What power. Aided by a short and wide delivery, Rohit flays a cut with terrific timing. The ball just flew to the point boundary. Uppish but in the gap
driven to mid-off with great timing again. Failed to keep it down though, and it reaches mid-off on the bounce

just about clears the fine leg boundary. Shortish delivery on Rohit's hips who looks to flick but the bounce does for him and he gets a thick top edge which flies in the air but wide of Paris at fine leg
whipped to square leg
not great lines. Straying on Paris' pads who turns him towards backward square leg for a couple
good comeback. Full but outside off, bringing Kohli forward. Defended watchfully
full and wide outside off, creamed to extra cover off the front foot
134 kph. Fullish on off, swinging back into Kohli who flicks to midwicket
not a bad delivery but a shot as well. Shortish outside off, but doesn't get high enough to Kohli who swivels and pulls in front of square for a couple. Rolled his wrists nicely to keep it down
adventurous. No real need for that stroke. Full on off at 136 kph. Kohli advances and looks to belt it over cover, but inside-edges towards short fine leg
nice start for Hastings. Good length on leg, Rohit misses his tuck and is struck on the pads. A muted appeal but that was too high
full on middle and leg, worked to short fine leg.
fullish but wider outside off. Kohli defends with a half-stride to the pitch
nudged off his hips towards midwicket for a run
nice delivery, Hastings goes wider of the crease and lands it on a good length. Defended
that is well played. Good length outside off, Rohit opens the face of is bat to dab to third man
full on a fifth-stump line. Rohit lunges forward to push to mid-off
132 kph. Lovely stuff from Boland. Close to the perfect area. Fuller than a good length just outside off. the ball swerves away from Rohit's naughty flirt

goes after it with a massive hoick. But Rohit gets a thick outside edge which flies in the air but wide of third man. Hastings runs around and fumbles to allow it to the boundary. he looks around guiltily
back of a length outside off, Rohit pokes but is beaten
turned away towards midwicket
nice and full from Boland, shaping this one back in to Rohit who whips to wide mid-on for one
another loose waft from Rohit. Nice length - fuller than a good length but wide outside off. Rohit is beaten
back of a length outside off, this time he lets it go
fullish and wide outside off, Rohit presses forward to caress to point
gets the cut this time. Shortish and wide, cut down to third man powerfully
nice stroke but good fielding from Faulkner at extra cover. Full and wide outside off, Kohli times a square drive
great over that. Good length outside off, Kohli chooses to let this one be
another edge from Rohit. Full outside off, Rohit pokes with soft hands, and the ball rolls to third man past slip
back of a length outside off, Kohli watchfully lets it go after thinking of playing a stroke
and now goes too straight, whipped away to deep square leg
135 kph, getting it right is Boland. Good length outside off, left alone once again
what a beauty from Rohit. Too full is Boland outside off. Rohit stays in is crease, gets his head over the ball and crunches an exquisite drive with superlative timing to the cover boundary
defended properly from the crease
135 kph. Shortish and wide, Kohli cuts ferociously but finds backward point
117 kph, very wide outside off. Kohli misses his cut and wide called
good delivery. Back of a length on off, quelled to point
quality. All quality from Kohli. Waits for Hastings to come to his areas before leaning into an on-drive through mid-on. Timed away to the fence. Presented the full face of the bat
fullish length outside off, patted to point
a caressed drive goes to the sweeper cover fielder
nice end. Tight lines outside off and Rohit respectfully keeps it out
another edge that doesn't carry. But ti\his fell way short of Finch. Kohli pokes with soft hands to Boland's full delivery outside off
clipped neatly off his pads to mid-on
played to midwicket off his hips
tight on off. Rohit cannot do much with that, other than block
back of a length outside off, Rohit opens the face to steer to third man
excellent running from Kohli. Knew exactly what he was doing all along. Back of a length on off, Kohli rises on his toes to turn the ball softly towards backward square leg, easily made the second
floated up on middle, driven back to Maxwell
tossed up again but drifts down leg, a fine sweep to deep fine leg
flatter down leg, swept powerfully to fine leg
the sweep goes finer this time and that will be four. Flatter on middle and leg, Rohit goes for the sweep but gets a thin bottom edge which helps it race to the fine leg fence
clipped to square leg off his pads
flighted outside off this time, looped up. Driven to extra cover
good length outside off, guided to point off the front foot
135 kph, the bouncer doesn't rise but Kohli rolls his wrists to pull to fine leg, all along the carpet
137 ks, Full on off. Rohit drives but finds cover
140 kph, opens the face to steer to the sweeper cover
dabbed to third man for another run.
a lifter from a good length. Slapped to point awkwardly
nicely bowled. Sees Kohli coming at him and he delivers it flat on middle, turned to midiwcket
fired in on middle and leg, Kohli goes for the sweep and just about gets bat on it to fine leg
oooh, just in front of Finch at extra cover. Tossed up outside off, Rohit looks to launch a drive but doesn't keep it down
shortish and wide, chopped to extra cover
goes on with the arm this time, a thick edge rolls to third man
turned towards Bailey at square leg who puts in a run-saving dive
back of a length outside off, pushed to deep point from the crease
good length outside off - fourth-stump line. Cut into the ground to point
drifts down leg this time, Kohli picks it off his pads towards fine leg for a couple. Cannot drift there
full length on off, inside-halved to square leg for one
that is a good change-up from Faulkner. Digs the bouncer in on middle but Rohit gets on to of his pull to find the gap behind square for four
full on off, blocked
flat on off, whipped to deep midwicket
fired in on middle and leg, clipped away to deep midwicket again
really good running. Kohli skips down the track to clip to long-on, the boundary is so deep that they get back for two easily
flat again on middle and leg, this time Kohli goes for the hard sweep with such timing and power that it whistled to the square leg boundary
races down the track to power a drive to cover
goes over square leg now. Fired in on middle and leg, Kohli sweeps again but gets a bit of a top edge as well
overly full outside off, drilled to cover who does well again with a  good diving stop. Bailey at it again
too wide this time, Rohit flays a drive to the sweeper cover
slightly too short and wide. Kohli gets on top of the bounce, and guides the cut past point for a couple
dabbed to third man
Rohit gets to another fifty. Danger signs for Australia. Yorker is dug out to square leg
138 kph on off, and full. Blocked
worked off his pads to deep square leg
rather full but on a tight line around off. Defended
straight again on middle and off, Kohli gets a leading edge after trying to turn to midwicket
very full outside off, powered to the sweeper
Wade does well. Faulkner drifts down leg and it pings off Rohit's pads, Wade scampers across and drives to prevent it from going through
excellent over this. Fullish on off, Rohit wants to drive on the up but the ball takes the inside edge onto his pads
banged in on a shortish length at 140 kph. Kohli stands tall to defend
137 kph, Kohli gets over the bounce to keep his pull down nicely, square leg cleans up
very full again, overpitched in fact. Drilled to cover
steered with power to the sweeper cover
nice running again from Kohli. Clips the fuller delivery wide of midwicket and sets off immediately, gets two easily
cut down to third man with a slightly loose waft
driven with great timing to mid-off. Kohli goes for a tough run and eases in despite a miss from Smith. They get an overthrow as well.
tight on off, Kohli defends watchfully
slower ball at 123 kph on off. Kohli guides to point in the aim for one, but Maxwell hurries to the ball
gets the gap this time does Kohli. He gets to another fifty as well. He races down to smash the ball past cover and to the boundary
played down towards point again
decent comeback from Faulkner actually. Full outside off, Kohli plays a punchy block to cover
138 kph. very tight lines around off. Rohit plays it defensively to point

flat six. What a shot that is. Picked the length so early and dispatched it with ease. A flat pull for six over midwicket off the front foot. That is deflating but Richardson dragged that a touch too short
drifts down leg, wide
good length on off, Rohit stays in his crease to defend
six more. Gets under the delivery and muscles a drive with exemplary timing over mid-off. That is some shot. Rohit getting a move along now.
goes short again, Rohit stands tall and crunches the pull to deep square leg
neatly and calmly driven to deep cover for one
tucked with soft hands, just about reached the 30-yard circle at fine leg. Easy brace
steered down to third man
flicked off his hips towards midwicket yet again
four more. Skips down the track and drives muscularly past cover. Once it beat the fielder, it was always going to be a tough ask to cut it off. The ball reaches the boundary

what has happened there? Some hesitation and Kohli may be gone here. And he is gone. Kohli has to walk off after a fantastic innings. Against the run of play, Australia have a breakthrough. He stayed back to pummel a pull to fine leg. Richardson got around and rocketed a throw back to Wade, on the full, and Wade whipped off the bails. Kohli was found a foot short of his crease despite a dive.
fullish outside off, driven to cover
135 kph, short of a length outside off, too wide for the batsman to want to play at
a fuller length with width outside off, Rohit slashes along the ground to third man
clipped through square leg
inside-edge. Luck for Rohit. Goes for a cut but that was too close to cut and he got a thick inside edge which just evaded the stumps and raced to the fine leg boundary
good length on off, blocked
sublime timing from Rohit. Stayed in his crease and drove on the up past cover, who got a hand on it.
whipped off his pads to deep square leg
length with width outside off, cut off the back foot really sweetly but Maxwell is in the way at point
presses forward and opens the face to steer a length ball to third man
full and straight, on off and middle, Rahane gets on the front foot and drives back to the bowler, Hastings picks up cleanly
moves back and across and cuts the ball late to third man
pushed off the front foot on the off side
short of a length outside off, stays back and guides the ball along the ground to third man
punched off the front foot towards the bowler
pushes forward and away from the body to drive a full ball through point, think he was looking to play that through cover actually, was on the move as he made contact with the ball
played with soft hands towards point for a single
defended on the front foot on the off side
fuller length on the pads, Rahane leans forward and clips through square leg
strays down leg side, the batsman gets down low and sweeps behind square
steps out and drives towards the non-striker, Maxwell moves quickly to his right to field
goes back and hits the ball to long on for a single
defended on the front foot back to the bowler
leans forward nudges the ball through mid off for a single
steps out and turns the ball off the pads in front of square leg, four runs off that over
short of a length outside off, stays back and guides the ball to third man
might have been finer than he wanted but he'll get four to third man, Rohit was looking to cut through point but the offcutter took the edge and flew wide of the keeper
punched off the front foot to cover
full and wide outside off, Rohit gets down low and cut the ball to third man
jumps back and tucks the ball off the pads through square leg
good length angling into the batsman, defended on the back foot
flat but drifts down leg, the umpire doesn't call a wide
floated up on off, Rahane runs down to drive back
flat outside off, driven to long-off
goes for the inside-out scoop, lands just in front of long-off.
dabbed to third man for one
slighted outside off, driven to long-off with ease
very full outside off, drilled past cover for three. Excellent fielding by Marsh at deep cover to keep it in
good length down leg, nurdled to deep square leg

gone? No, says the umpire. All fielders went up in unison. Big nick on snicko. Very unlucky for Australia. Good delivery, shaping away outside off. Rohit prodded and got a thin edge. Big let off for Rohit
driven to long-off
shortish delivery outside off, chopped down to third man
slower delivery, 120 kph. Worked to square leg
floated up outside off, nicely driven to long-off
fired in on off, Rahane goes back to punch to long-on
swept powerfully to fine leg
skips down the track to drive the flighted delivery to long-on
flat on leg, Rohit gets down early to sweep to fine leg
slightly too short and spinning down leg, Rahane helps it on its way towards fine leg. Two for Rahane
good length on off, patted down to point
shaped away outside off but full. Blocked
back of a length on off, moving away. Rohit plays it towards the bowler
worked off the open face to third man
excellent work from Wade yet again. Chopped down towards third man, Wade scampers across and keeps the ball in
good length outside off, worked with soft hands towards backward square leg. Rahane races back for the second. Good stuff
full on off from around the wicket, drilled to long-off
awesome shot. Presented the full face of the bat to drive right over the non-striker. Uppish but that was very straight and four more.
fuller length and wide, driven to deep cover
hit to cover from the crease
driven uppishly but just wide of Faulkner's hands. Very full on middle, Rohit did not time his drive
a slapped drive to cover who does well to get a hand on it. Very wide and full from Faulkner
132 kph, nice delivery. Good length on off, Rahane can only defend
back of a length outside off, played down to third man
clipped straight to midwicket. Eating a few dot balls here is Rohit
shortish delivery outside off, swatted to deep cover
shortish again outside off, this one skids through and beats Rahane's outside edge.
poor delivery. Slower ball down leg, worked fine to short fine leg who does well despite a fumble
fullish delivery to start, played to point from the crease
guided to third man off the open face
yorker on off, Rahane keeps it out to mid-on
back of a length outside off, driven with a flat bat towards the sweeper cover
good tight bowling. Length delivery on off, Rohit blocks
Rohit drives the fuller delivery to cover. Another dot ball
back of a length outside off, played away towards point. Maxwell prevents the run
swatted away over midwicket. Rahane runs down at Paris and lofts him with a cross-batted swipe over midwicket. That will be four
chopped to third man

and there it is. Rohit's second consecutive century in the series. Waits for the ball to come to him before playing it down to third man. Takes off his helmet, leaps in celebration, lets out a big smile and raises his bat. Well played
slower delivery outside off, Rahane opens the face to guide to third man yet again
another ramp off the open face to third man
inside-edged to backward square leg for two. Very full delivery on off, he goes for a drive but can only squeeze the delivery with bad timing
this one ducks back in from KR, forcing Rohit to inside-half to square leg
good length on middle, pushed with the full face to long-on
yorker on leg, squirted to deep square leg
worked off his pads to backward square leg for a run. Rohit took a few steps for the second but was sent back just in time
fullish delivery on off, driven to mid-off
dropped. Very hard chance. Full on off, Rahane goes for the full-blooded drive and hits it well, Hastings can only get a hand on it and parry to mid-on
slower delivery outside off, drilled to long-off
advances down to thrash the ball over cover but the ball is too wide outside off
slower delivery, extracts a lot of bounce. Rahane tries to guide to third man but cannot get bat on it
goes straight again. Very full on off, Rahane chooses the straight option. Long-on fields
length delivery on middle, that was just a short-arm jab that raced past fine leg. Nowhere near it well enough but the placement is superb
oh, this is terrific. Gets a similar delivery on his ribs and Rohit just helps it on its way to the backward square leg fence again. Lovely batting
shot. Rahane this time. Runs at the bowler and hits the drive on the up past cover. Not at all full enough for him to get under it but he hits it on the up with really good timing
not a great ball this time. Rahane just picks it off his pads to the fine leg boundary. Hastings puts in a dive but cannot do anything
drifts down leg, wide
full on leg, pushed to long-on
135 kph, whipped off his pads to fine leg
133 kph, very full on middle. Driven to long-on comfortably
back of a length delivery outside off, played away to point
good length outside off, Rahane gets fifty now with a nicely delayed cut past point for a couple
fuller length on off, Rahane drives nicely to long-on. Good use of the wrists
short and wide, was there to be played but Rohit misses. An opportunity goes
slower delivery, out of the back of the hand. Rohit launches a swipe over midwicket. Did not get enough of it at all. Maxwell fires a throw to the keeper
full outside off, squeezed to deep cover for a run. Good over for Aus, just six off it
superb timing from Rohit. Full on off, Rohit gets one foot out of the way, open his bat face and carves it over cover for four. Just lands inside the boundary.
digs this one in very short, loops over Rohit's head
right in the arc for a big hit but Rohit decides to drive to long-on to get one
nice yorker on off, Rahane squeezes it out to cover
slower ball, trying to follow a backing-away Rohit who comes inside the line, wide
backs away again, Rohit drives to long-on with bad timing, bat turned in his hands
guided off the bat face to short third man
looked to find that gap behind point, but the ball races off the outside edge to short third man who does well with a diving stop
massive hit. Again, he runs down to the pitch but gets nowhere near the length delivery. He goes through with the flat-batted hit and the ball goes easily over long-on. Classy batting

Rohit is gone. What a sad way to go, but that is the luck of the draw. He isn't very happy. Rahane drives a slower delivery back at Faulkner who gets a bit of his hand on it, to deflect the ball onto the leg stump. End of a splendid innings from Rohit.
tickled towards backward square. Rahane sends Dhoni back
shortish delivery on middle and leg, pulled to square leg easily
yorker on off, Rahane digs it out back to Faulkner who misfields and allows the run
pretty clever batting from Dhoni. Faulkner digs one in very short on off, he forehands the pull in front of deep square leg for a couple
really good shot from Jinxy. low full toss on off, Rahane drives past the bowler and to long-off for a couple
fuller length on off, driven powerfully to cover
yikes. Ugly hoick that. Slower ball outside off, offcutter. Rahane gets down on one knee to sweep but the extra ball takes the ball over
another extra. Short offcutter down leg
low full toss on middle and leg, driven to long-on
yorker outside off, scooped to cover
worked off his pads but finds midwicket. Great over from Boland
back of a length delivery on leg, Dhoni just plays it with soft hands and races back for the second run.
shovelled away from a good length to square leg
lots of the bottom hand used. Full delivery outside off, Rahane thrashes it to long-on
low full toss outside off, Dhoni looked to find the gap past point but sliced his stroke to third man

whoa, how did that miss the stumps? Slower delivery, back of the hand legcutter. Rahane hurries across the stumps to ramp over fine leg, thereby exposing his stumps. The extra bounce from the legcutter took it over
another good one. Rahane comes down but cannot connect with his lofted drive. Just five off it again
low full toss on middle, pushed back to the bowler
whipped off his hips to square leg. Another shovelled stroke into the leg side off the length delivery
good yorker on off, hit down to long-off

amazing fielding from Maxwell, just exemplary. saved the boundary. Low full toss on middle, Rahane times the on-drive with terrific timing. Maxwell scurries across and pits in an acrobatic effort to keep it in
another low full toss outside off, Rahane lofts the drive on the bounce to long-off

gone. Dhoni's iffy innings ends. Slower ball, but in the slot. Dhoni belts it with a lot of power but straight down the throat of long-on. Maxwell settles under it and takes a sitter. India stuttering again
wide yorker outside off, Rahane digs it out towards the bowler who runs around, collects cleanly but cannot hit the stumps. A direct hit would have had Pandey
130 kph, full delivery on off, Pushed to cover
back of a length, Pandey gets on top of the bounce to guide to third man
excellently-executed yorker on off. Rahane squirts it out back.
that is one way to get a boundary. Full length outside off, Rahane looks to go over midwicket but gets a thick outside edge which flies to the third man fence
another low full toss outside off, creamed to deep cover
another yorker. Perfect. Outside off. Rahane gets a bit of an under edge on it to the keeper
gives himself room and drives towards point for a couple. Again, a close-to-perfect yorker
another brace. Yorker outside off, Rahane drives powerfully past cover for two
gets the gap this time does Rahane. Boland misses his yorker and it ends up as a low full toss on middle and leg, Rahane lifts it over midwicket and to the boundary. Important boundary
nicely carved. Gets a low full toss outside off, Rahane slices the drive past point for a couple. Finch does well in the outfield
turned to square leg, Rahane scurries back for two. Rahane gets 12, India get 12.
very full and wide outside off, carved to third man for a single
another full toss outside off, Rahane slices the drive over point for two. Goes into those massive pockets in this outfield

gone. Steven Smith takes the catch as Rahane falls. Back of the hand legcutter on off, Rahane comes down and swipes it in the air but the ball hangs in the air for a long time. He did not get enough distance and Smith settles under it at deep midwicket to swallow the catch
four runs for Pandey. Very full and wide, Pandey cuts powerfully past point for a boundary. 300 up for India

another one goes. Pandey this time. Length delivery on middle, Pandey wanted to go through midwicket but the legcutter stopped in the wicket a touch to take the top edge of Pandey, the ball carries to long-off who takes another easy one
another slower delivery on middle, Jadeja clips in the gap in front of midwicket for a couple
length delivery outside off, Ashwin runs at the bowler to push to point
full delivery on off, Jadeja gets bat on the ball to point for one. Seems a concerted effort to at least get a run a ball
gone. Ashwin goes now. Full delivery on off, Ashwin walks across to ramp to fine leg but the ball deviates away only to take the top edge, the ball spoons up for short third man to take.
low full toss, pushed to long-on for a run. Marsh returns an awkward throw to Hastings who can't collect cleanly. An overthrow is conceded
full and wide yorker, Jadeja goes for a cheeky ramp. But misses
excellent last over from Hastings. Just four runs off it. Yorker on off, Jadeja digs it out back to the bowler. Hastings collects and takes off the bails.
128 kph, a short ball that balloons into Dhoni's gloves outside off as Finch decides he can do nothing and get an extra
138kph, back of a length, no room on offer, Finch attempts a leg glance but does not make contact
another short ball, this time at a better line. Finch does not have the room to free his arms as he tries to pull, and can only guide it to square leg
134 kph, that time he did have the width he needs to swivel on the back foot and drag the ball from outside off to the midwicket boundary.
adjusts his line and having kept it closer to off stump, the back of a length ball keeps Finch quiet
on the pads, deflected to the fine leg boundary with barely any trouble. Sran needs to stick to middle, middle and off, at his pace
that's much better, he looks far more threatening when he brings the right-hander forward and plays on the angle across him. Finch knows it too as he leaves the ball wisely
sweetly driven through the covers. It was a touch overpitched from the returning Ishant and the returning Marsh steps forward and gives it just enough to skip away
slips a good length ball down the leg side, Finch tries the old heave ho over square leg, but it was meandering too far down his pads
he's got a bit of inswing going, but he might be starting it a touch straight.

mild appeal from behind the wicket as the ball catches something and makes a noise as it passes the batsman. The fuller, inswinger again from Ishant. Finch tries a flick and gets only a bit of trouser
138 kph, Ishant goes up now, for an lbw shout, as Finch is caught lead-footed on leg stump. Tries the flick again, but the inward movement Ishant is getting is troubling the batsman
that time he leans in and connects neatly enough. It is a little uppish, but fine leg is deep so Finch doesn't need to bother about keeping the flick down
138kph, back of a length and outside off, a tad too far actually, and Marsh leaves

a 134 kph beauty! Don't worry about the speed though. It's only meant to help catch the batsman in two minds and Ishant did. Marsh is caught on the crease and pushing at a back of a length delivery seaming away from him. Lucky not to nick
the short balls keep a'comin. So much that Finch needs to leap off his feet to get on top of this one on leg stump and nudges it to long leg

138 kph, a little quicker than Marsh anticipated. The shortish delivery zips off the deck, as it can happen under lights, and ducks back in at him. Goes for the pull, but is barely into position by the time the ball hits his side
eases the ball off his thighs behind square leg to get off strike. Rohit puts in the slide to keep it to a single

that's always a threat with the left-armer. The sucker ball outside off, especially in limited-overs cricket with the new ball. Finch wants to take it over extra, big booming drive comes calling, nobody home
good length ball on and around fifth stump, Finch covers his stumps and shoulders arms
short and on middle, Finch has no trouble directing it to long leg and picking up a second run
penalised by the ump for straying a bit too far outside off. Marsh realises he can do nothing and give Australia a run for the chase
just back of a length and outside off, Marsh shuffles across a tad and lets it through
short and wide, Marsh should have banished that to the point boundary. But since his feet aren't quite moving yet, he hits it straight to Jadeja
too easy. Ishant loses his line, Marsh makes sure it hurts with a little tickle down to the fine leg boundary. India are struggling to stay one side of the wicket in the first few overs
gets in line with a shortish delivery on off stump

that's better. Starts the ball on leg stump, which is more or less perfect for the angle across the left-hander. Marsh is squared up as he defends off the back foot. Now if he can get that ball fuller...

that was travelling, and Jadeja dives to his left to stop a certain boundary. Ishant strays short and wide and this time Marsh moves back and across to pounce. He had nearly placed it wide of the fielder, but a fit Jadeja is a tough man to beat

lovely bowling, that's what you want your new-ball bowler to do. Bowl fullish, get the batsman forward but not give him the drive, then coax a lifeless pitch into offering some seam away. Finch is beaten. Soundly
back-to-back beauties! Sran has begun an excellent over, starting on off stump, sucking the batsman into a front-foot defence, and beating him with seam away off the deck
that cut back in to Finch! It was shortish and pitched wider of off stump, so Finch had set up for the cut. In the end he ends up with an inside edge

a few inches fuller on middle and leg, which is the reason why Finch is caught in the crease and hurries to bring his bat down. So it comes through across the line and hits him in the pads. Loads of questions being asked

and he finishes it by maintaining that teasing line just outside off to the left-hander too. A touch short, and hint of shape away. The only thing in favour of the batsman there was the length - short - so even though he is squared up, he can stay on the back foot and block
tap and run cricket from Australia. Finch steps forward to put the ball into the covers and Marsh answers before Pandey running in could become a threat

ooh, Marsh is not sure about this, but Finch was the man running to the danger end and he was never in doubt. It's a back of a length ball that cramps the batsman, who gets an inside edge and the ball had stopped a foot or so away from Marsh. Ishant attempted a run out by kicking the ball at the stumps, but ends up stomping on it
hits a good length, ball kisses the pitch and seams down leg. Finch tries to use the pace and send it to the long leg boundary. Has to settle for a wide

much better from Ishant, summons a good length ball at 135 kph and gets it to dart back into Finch. Batsman knows this period is dicey and he blocks into the midwicket region. Good little skirmish this
gets across on onto off stump and flicks the ball to the man at long leg.

that's good. India needs to stay there to both batsman, perhaps at a fuller length. Marsh is squared up again, but because it is short, he can adjust and soften his hands to ensure the away swinger is easily blunted to point

shades of how he got out in Perth! Takes a fuller ball outside off and slugs it back down the ground. The bat turns on impact, because he was concentrating on power, no caught and bowled this time though
back of a length ball on off stump, blocked
sneaks in the short ball, Finch saw the length early and on instinct went for the pull, but on the left-armer's angle that's a tough shot. Misses it
fuller ball on off stump, tapped down the ground to mid-offf
waits on the shortish delivery on off stump, moves across to off stump and pads it through midwicket
nicely done. Finch keeps to his back foot where both batsman have been comfortable and finds a single through midwicket.
not quite the room he thought it had, but Finch adjusts well enough. Jumps up to get on top of the shortish delivery on fifth stump and chops it to short third man
the hit-me ball, and Marsh is only too happy to put it away through point. Sran at third man has a bit of work to do, and his being positioned squarer than usual helps. Solid cut shot
he is still getting a little nip into the right-hander, Finch's body language suggests. Back of a length ball on off stump, blocked

inside edge ruins Ishant's appeal, and Finch survives a skiddy indipper. Pitches the ball up a touch more, catches Finch on the crease and hitting across the line towards wide mid-on. A little quicker than that and he would have had him
slower and a bit wider outside off, perhaps to suck him into a false shot, Finch is wary of the trap and leaves
back of a length and outside off, pushed into the covers
fuller delivery just outside off, Marsh runs it down to the other new-ball bowler Ishant at deep third man
got into position for the swivel pull in a flash, but he has picked out the deep fine leg fielder
not quite short enough for the pull there, also this one zips into Marsh and cramps him for room. Mistimed to midwicket
gets up on his toes to blunt the shortish delivery on middle and off to midwicket
covers the line and blocks the short ball on fourth stump. Could do nothing more at this stage, with a slip still in
Rohit continues to have an excellent match. Dives at midwicket to stop a Marsh pull that simply flew off the bat.
oooh, never give Finch width. He was going for the awayswinger, and he does get some curl, but Finch timed it excellently to cover
goes short, but affords the width the batsman wants. Finch climbs into it, but he can't beat the offside ring
back of a length on off stump, punched into the covers. Straight at Kohli, who runs into the ball to stop the single. All looked well until the misfield
full and a bit outside off, pushed to mid-off. Kohli attempts to pull something out of the hat with a direct hit at the non-strikers' and he may well had caught Finch out!
picked away to deep square leg, simple option with the length short and the line down leg
on off stump and on a good length. Finch presents the full face.
starts on middle and Marsh had already set up to flick the ball around the corner and had to delay his shot
chops a short and wide ball through the wide open space at cover
a touch too straight again and Marsh keeps on his back foot to secure the easy single to deep midwicket

turn! bounce! Hope for India! Dhoni was unable to keep to it, that's how surprising it was. But he should like this development. The ball pitched on a good length and simply took off past the outside edge, puff of dust and all
tossed up outside off, belted down the ground to long-on. Just to make sure the bowler doesn't get carried away.
picked away off his pads to deep square leg
dangerous little cut shot because that ball was rather full, Marsh manages to slice it to point
tossed up on middle and leg, defended
eases down the pitch and drives through the covers. Careful shot that. Made sure he didn't get carried away
plants that front foot outside off to lap sweep a flighted delivery from outside off. Jaddu is the man prowling around there and he keeps it to one
goes straight on with the arm and with Marsh looking to play around his front pad, he gets nothing on it

held this back a touch and that's why Marsh is unsure of the shot he wants. Came forward and then had to wait for the ball, which bounces a tad too. Hits him high on the splice and finds a single at cover
goes for the sweep, may have had a tickle on it because the umpire didn't call it a wide. Dhoni doesn't miss many behind the stumps to the spinner

drops a sitter, and Ishant has to suffer a round of boos. This was coming at a lovely height, straight at him at long-on. Marsh had wanted to break free, ran down the pitch and lofted the ball. Didn't connect well enough, but gets a lovely, large slice of luck
good length ball that rips away from Finch, who reaches out to block
worked past midwicket
tossed up, slotted into the covers
shortish, picked away through midwicket
good length ball on and around off stump, defended
holds on the pitch, and ends up ripe for a flat-batted pull to long-on
some turn, but of the slow kind, as Finch stays on his back foot and nudges it around the corner
goes flatter and quicker on middle and leg, Marsh who was making room suddenly has none. defends

a full blooded cut, from leg stump, gets a thick edge that bursts through slip. Rahane was the man who shoots his hands up to try and contrive a chance, but this was as much a catch as I am a hippopotamus.
flighted outside off, Marsh drives through extra cover
92 kph, gets some turn, but it suits the batsman. Marsh waits for it on the back foot and hits with it to deep midwicket
backs away to cut a shortish delivery from off stump to the sweeper cover
fired in at 94 kph, on middle and leg, punched back down the ground
perhaps that's why Finch went for the slog and ends up with an inside edge. It still fetches a couple of runs to deep square leg
nice and tight on middle and off, Finch went back and bunts it down the pitch. Doesn't like that it offers him nothing
moves away to cut a shortish delivery from the stumps to deep point.
picks the shortish length quickly, clears his front leg and cuts to cover. Nicely done.
lunges outside off to sweep the tossed up ball outside off to deep fine leg
too short again, Marsh has an easy punt to deep long-on
turning into off stump, off a good length ball too, that's why Finch can't connect with his cut properly
huge appeal from Ashwin as Finch sets up for a lap sweep, but the shortish, straight one on middle, had taken enough of an inside edge before it hit pad. Single to fine leg
gently eased to long-off to wrap up the over
short, wide, hammered. And so early had he seen this buffey ball that Marsh has clomped the ball past mid-off

142 kph, hurries Marsh because his line threatens middle stump. That bit of extra pace makes him indecisive and the way he makes up for it is by playing across the line. Hit on the thigh, but Finch saves his partner by rushing across for a single
tickled away to fine leg, no bat though
slower ball, but he has lost control of it. Marsh has no trouble putting the misdirected offcutter where it deserves to go - to the fine leg boundary
on the pads again, flicked to deep square leg
full and just outside off, dug out to mid-on and Finch inspects the bottom of the bat after the fact
tossed up on middle and leg, sent back where it came from
quick feet puts Marsh waiting for the late cut, but he has found backward point
that bat was a little straighter because the ball was a touch fuller on off stump, pushed to deep point
misfield from the bowler allows Finch to get off strike. Good ball too, full on off stump, only allowed Finch a drive down the ground. Could have been for nothing
straying down leg, clipped through midwicket
deftly worked to midwicket and was prepared to run, until he realised that man was in close and it was Virat Kohli

oh, you have to say that was well done from Marsh. Came in second best as a 142kph shortish delivery cramps him for room. The ball wanders into the off side after hitting his body, Finch pulls him across for a quick single and Marsh makes sure he saves himself from a run-out. Ran in a perfectly straight line, trouble happens only when you change direction as he got himself between the bowler's throw and the stumps and wore the blow too
full and curling in at the right-hander, Finch is all over the pace as he tries to flick across the line. Hits the front pad and weathers an lbw appeal
gets up on top of a short ball outside off and chops it to point. Should have at least got one there
pushes the ball a touch fuller on middle and off, and its 142 kph too, so Finch who was trying for a clip through square leg finds the ball ending up at midwicket because it hit the bat too high
he isn't holding himself back, that's for sure. Takes on the short ball even though he has not timed too many in this innings. Mis-hits the pull and gets a couple over midwicket
jumps back and flicks the shortish ball through to deep square leg
presses forward and pats the flighted delivery to long-on
tries to cut the ball off himself, but the nudge towards mid-on beats him
waits for the shortish ball to turn into him and then ease it behind square leg

that's good shot. He's tried a similar shot before, but the late cut found point. Now Marsh backs away, cuts the ball, it turns away from the sweeper as it gathers speed as Dhoni indicated, but Ishant is a bit too slow
sweeps from outisde off to find a single at long leg
flighted on middle, sent back down the pitch
called early, response immediate, quick single pinched without the ball going three feet from the stumps

fullish on middle and leg, Marsh has only managed an inside edge onto pad, and yet he finds himself with a single to midwicket. Australia have decided no more dot balls. He's hurt himself as well, playing the flick. The bat just jammed onto his leg because he was hurried into the shot

shuffles across and finds a smart boundary at long leg. Smart because he knows he is not going to get too many freebies outside off, but when he does get that one straying down leg, he makes sure to put it away
jumps back on middle and leg to put the shortish ball to midwicket

lifts the fuller ball down the ground, and he had to put in every bit of his strength because the bat turns in his hand. Nowhere near the timing he can generate, but he is still somehow making it work.

how about that! He reaches fifty with a shot that has the stamp of a batsman in plundering form. It was length, tailing into him, Finch moved his front leg across and a good old whip(lash) of the wrists takes the ball soaring over square leg

oh, that's a seriously risky single! Marsh had deflected the ball towards fine leg and is pulled into a quick single. They take on a fast bowler's arm - Yadav's - but Ashwin doesn't want to. He thinks this will be a direct hit and simply stepped away from the stumps. No backing up either, so they get a second when this should have been an easy run out
short and wide outside off, cut away to Ishant at deep point. That's Marsh's fifty as well
tossed up outside off and Finch loves the width on offer. Leans forward and chips the ball over extra cover. Rohit does well to keep the ball inside the boundary
ohhh, that is clever. He knew third man was up, he saw this short and wide and he delayed the cut shot just enough to pick the gap behind point
goes for the sweep and gets enough of an inside edge to find a single at fine leg
flighted outside off, driven to long-off
more punishment. Marsh gets deep in his crease and short-arm jabs a boundary over wide long-on
flat, sharp delivery on middle and leg, picked through midwicket

brilliant! He has been buying his runs any way he could, from any edge he could so far, and having been there for so long, he has suddenly figured out the trick to his timing. Jumped back to make a shortish ball even shorter and cuts it behind point
disdain! That's what I saw in Finch's eyes as he watched the ball sail into the midwicket fence. Got to the pitch and all he did was power the ball away with his wrists
patted down the ground now that he's struck two fours earlier

pushed through on off stump, and yet there remains a single before the cover fielder can catch up to it. Australia have made their move. India have become scatterbrained. They need to slow this game down or the hosts can simply ride this wave all the way to the end
141kph, that's been India's problem. They haven't been able to concentrate enough balls on one side of the wicket. This one is short and slips down leg. Marsh goes for the swivel pull and misses.

ooooh, Sran nearly had it! He nearly had a catch to remember until the end of time. Marsh had timed the leather off this short ball and the pull had four, maybe even six, all over it. But in pops the left-arm fast bowler, dives and is horizontal with the ground when he grabbed the ball with two hands. But it pops out
gets away to the other end with a single to long-off
back of a length on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
chopped to point, Marsh was looking for the single to the sweeper but hit it off the bottom of the bat

two they call after Marsh works it off his pads, and two they take even with one of the better Indian fielders on the square leg boundary. Pandey ran in and sent a flat throw to the bowler's end, but Finch had made it safely
time for the swivel pull, but it was a little too far wide of him to connect
pat and run, this is excellent cricket from the Australians. And the best description of their pace between the pitch is that Finch and Marsh have been able to beat Jadeja at point
tossed up on off stump, given a home at long-on
flighted outside off, driven to extra cover
just short enough that Finch can go back and carve the ball to point
if the ball had a voice, it would be squealing. Finch moves a touch to the leg side and smears it through extra cover. Rahane needed the dive to stop that from going to the boundary

that's the Test world-record holder! Rahane has pulled off a blinder at long-off! This was another that Finch thought he could smoke over extra, and so he did. Except this time he had hit it in the air and gave that fielder a chance. Rahane moves swiftly to his left, eyes on the ball all the way, dives forward and grabs the ball inches from the turf. Brilliant
tossed up on off stump, solid defence from Smith
and the fielders recognise the importance of this phase. Jaddu swoops in on this front-foot defence from Marsh and stops the two Australians from going for a single
back of a length and wicket-to-wicket, Marsh can't do no more than block it
excellent cut shot, he seems to make sure to bring that bat down as late as possible to get the most runs off that late cut whether it is pace or spin
good length ball on the stumps, Marsh knocks it back down the pitch

lifter! And it needed a good nut like that to beat Marsh's late cut. He had set himself up in a lovely position to guide the ball away, but Ishant has long had a secret little deal with Australia pitches wherein certain balls just burst off the deck and leave the batsman bemused
shortish and outside off, run to point
goes back and whips a shortish ball through to deep midwicket
flighted on off stump, defended back at the bowler
just over short midwicket! Smith steps out of his crease, that by itself is a feat against the darts Jaddu bowls, and then he drags a ball  from way outside off with impeccable timing over Pandey
eases the ball through the covers
turns a shortish delivery behind square leg
flighted on middle, pushes to long-on and even runs showing the full face of the bat
banged in short, Smith steps inside the line to pull it away fine, not able to do so.
all he did was bring the bat down on top of the shortish ball outside off. Didn't even deign to move his feet
back of a length and outside off, picked away past wide mid-on
pleasant drive off the front foot and Dhawan puts in the dive at mid-off to stop the runs

that slip had been in business! Pandey flew low to his left, got both hands to it, but he can't hold onto it. Irony for Ishant. After he had dropped a dolly, he gets a toughie dropped off him. Amid all that, how could Marsh simply guide the ball there like it was catching practice. Did he not see the slipper?
beautiful cricket from Smith. He's been on Sran's case since the last game, and this time he takes on the young fast bowler's arm and turns a late cut for one into a late cut for a briskly run two
fullish and outside off, pasted away to mid-on
goes back to the flatter one and pushes to midwicket
a little slower, and a bit more flight. Midwicket comes into play again
worked into midwicket again as Marsh does not have any room to work it
a frustrated swipe across the line of the ball gets a toe end and becomes a single to point
back of a length and outside off, goes for the cut and misses
flighted onto the pads, whipped away to deep midwicket
fullish and just outside off, defended towards cover
stands up tall behind a short of a length ball and guide it to cover point
punched to short cover as Ishant keeps a steady line on off stump
nicely done. Ishant saw Smith moving away outside leg and followed him with a fuller ball. Keeps it to a single to mid-off

hurries him, leading edge, taken by Kohli! That's the bowling leader India want, the man who can dismiss the set batsman. Marsh had set up for the clip through midwicket, but the shortish ball holds on the pitch and comes up with a bit too much height on it. He can't control the shot, he has lost his balance, he pops a high catch to short cover
just back of a good length on off stump, defended

offers probably the worst ball he could to Smith - short and wide - hammered to point who does excellently well to get a hand on it. It we had Hot-Spotted that, the ball would have left a streak as it went after Jaddu
sets up for the pull a touch too early, and the short ball from Sran arrives late enough to get the Australia captain's inside edge
opens himself up and pulls a short ball from outside off through midwicket
that's got the imprint of a man in form. Bailey presses forward fluently and threads the gap at cover. Yadav on the cover boundary only just manages to cut to his right and stop it
moves across outside off and slides a shortish delivery off the open face to point.
moves onto off stump, so Sran has to bowl even further outside off. Pierces the field at cover again
keeps the ball on a good length on middle, Bailey whips it away through midwicket
punched to long-on as Ashwin keeps from flighting the ball

moves across, and forward, plants the bat down like a ramp for the ball to jump off of. But it hits nothing and Dhoni who had expected the batsman to connect with the lap sweep had moved too far to his left to collect that
gets down the track and flicks the ball through midwicket
eased to the yawning gap at deep midwicket again
tossed up on middle, worked to midwicket
back of a length and outside off, sliced into the covers
short and wide, Bailey goes for the cut and gets a thick outside edge that flies to third man
mistimes an off drive, and it is an off drive even though Smith had cleared his front leg and was playing it off the back foot to a fuller ball outside off

moves well across his off stump, Sran moves even wider with his short ball, Smith still goes for a pull and toe-ends the ball into the off side. Oh, amid all that, the bowler has overstepped, so it's a free hit
92 kph, might have been the back of the hand slower ball that went awry. Smith had loaded up his baseball stance and stood waiting for it for an age before he toe-ends this too down the ground
belts the cross-seamer down the ground! Overpitched and Bailey dials the sightscreen perfectly
short and wide, Bailey finds point with the cut
chipped to mid-on and and in the time it takes for that man to jump off the boundary and come to the ball, they get a couple. Rohit is not the slowest fielder, mind
flighted delivery outside off, defended into the covers
goes back to a fullish delivery and punches the ball, whilst leaving all his stumps open, to cover
leans on his front foot and picks the fielder at midwicket
tries to place this to long-on and find the single he wanted. But Kohli cuts across and stops all that
oooh, that was close. Ashwin had seen Smith making room and followed him, gets some turn off the deck as well, and beats the push into the covers. Good take from Dhoni behind the stumps
heaved away to deep midwicket, mistimed badly
full and wide outside off, Smith slaps it down the ground to long-off
gets an inside edge as he tries to reach for a full and wide one outside off
"catch" comes an optimistic ball as Bailey is unable to pick Kohli off the pitch. The ball had held up and his decision to hit through the line nearly cost him
that's poor, but expected from the part-timer. Drops this short and Smith creams it through midwicket.
oooh, inside edge! The result of Smith playing back to something he should have been forward to. Tries to slice the ball through point and it ends up missing the off stump by a whisker
down the track, but he can't reach the pitch. Well bowled by Ashwin, denies room and the leverage. No run to midwicket
so he goes for the sweep, the escape shot against non-turning off spin, but here it bounces. And Bailey gets a top edge for a single
dabbed into the leg side, and since the fielders are all on the boundary, Smith can rush back for a second.
clipped straight to Dhawan in front of the square leg ump
Jaddu has been placed there just for this shot, Smith lunges across and sweeps powerfully. Looked like four to his left, but he races across and keeps it to one
full and on middle, whipped through midwicket
full on off, a hint of inward movement to Bailey who confidently drives to mid-off
just wide of point. Good length outside off, Bailey flays a cut in the air but evading point. Third man cleans up but the pair get two
good delivery. Fuller than a good length on off, Bailey stays in his crease to block to cover
picked his shot, picked his delivery and executed perfectly. Backed away, saw the delivery a touch too short and swatted the ball over mid-on with enviable nonchalance. Shot.
back of a length outside off, Bailey tries to dab to third man but the ball zips past Bailey's attempted late cut
steered comfortably to third man from the crease
floated up on off, drilled to long-on with the turn
chipped to long-on. Lovely batting, raced to the pitch and then just pushed the ball straight and stole a couple
flatter on leg, pushed with the full face of the bat to long-on
well bowled this time, drags his length back just a touch. Bailey runs down and inside-edges to square leg
what a shot that is. Not a bad delivery at all. Flat on middle, Smith hurries back and makes room for himself. Clobbers the cut deftly in the gap behind point for four
two more. Flat on leg, Smith tickles it into the leg side and races back for the second. Easily done
nope. It's a short one and Bailey has sliced it away to the sweeper cover
how does he do that? Throws his front leg aside and goes to club the ball down the ground, when it was short of a length and barely a smidge outside off. Guess that's why he mistimed it
now he jumps outside off and clips the very same ball - shortish and just outside off - to deep midwicket
slapped away to Rahane on the point boundary, they go for the run on the throw and make it easily
full and seemed to tail in a touch, Bailey is not bothered at all as he hammers it to mid-off

oh, so simply, deftly, effortlessly done. All Bailey did was step forward and block a good length ball. That's playing to merits. But so well had he placed it - right between cover and mid-off - and so deftly had he touched it, that he is at the other end before any fielder can reach the ball. Brilliant.
slower ball slides down the leg side, Bailey can't get the tickle he wants but can still be happy Australia get runs and an extra ball

jittery old shot from Bailey, and Ishant has a forlorn look on his face as he watches the ball disappear to the long leg boundary. What more can he do? Put the ball on a good length and made the batsman uncertain. Bailey attempts a defensive push, but he had no balance doing so and left a big gap to boot. Doesn't happen
a little legcutter from Ishant, which gets the edge as Bailey tries to put it to third man, but dies on its way to the keeper
a lot more width outside off and he is able to guide the ball through to deep third man

smeared down the ground! Ishant got a hand to it - it could only have been a reflex catch and he has a history of not being able to pull those off - but testament to how little chance he had that is because Ashwin running back from mid-off can't get to it
full and wide outside off - because Smith made it so by opening up his stance - carved to mid-off. Gee, he looks like a cave man swinging his club.
rises up to his ribcage, but Bailey gets on top of it and blunts it towards the square leg region
width offered and Bailey goes after it with a flay over point
good length ball on middle and off, Smith puts it to long-on
picks up the short ball and jabs it away between deep midwicket and deep long-on
shortish and sliding down, Bailey pulls to long leg

zips through and topples off! There's the danger of showing off your stumps to a fast bowler. He had hit a cut shot off a delivery on middle against Ashwin, tried to repeat that against Yadav, who bowls it on a good length and gets the ball to skid through to beat his self-inflicted and limited defences
back of a length on off stump, blocked under his eyes
down the track, gets a touch too close to the flat delivery outside off, and drives to long-off
goes back against the good length ball and blocks it
defends a fuller delivery on off stump without moving his feet. Premeditating that Jaddu will bowl flat
leading edge flies away to the sweeper in the deep. Loads of wristwork behind the shot as he tries to lift the ball over the off side infield
pulls out the reverse sweep, and its only his fifth ball in. Manages to lob the infield again even though he didn't connect well
leans forward and blocks on middle and leg

ooh, that wasn't the most comfortable little guide to third man. Yadav slings down a 143 kph back of a length delivery right over off stump and it almost seemed like Maxwell had decided he would play no other shot
a little more width there which allows Bailey to carve the ball behind point
thumped over cover, and only Rahane and that large boundary over there prevents the four. Again, he barely moved his feet but was able to adjust with his hands
a little too short and just outside off, Bailey is hardly even interested

past the wicketkeeper! Hale and healthy nick as Bailey looks to hammer it down the ground, but the fuller ball ends up 180 degrees behind him. Dhoni went up, a tad slow, and to his right but can't reach it
slotted behind square leg to retain strike

picked up the slower ball and launched it into the crowd beyond long-off. Absolutely serene, and just about the perfect way to reach his fifty. Lovely stride forward, full swing of the arms, simply put away
shortish and outside off, slower again, pulled to deep midwicket
116 kph, that time the offcutter works because he puts it on a good length and slants it across the new batsman, instead of the set one. Maxwell is beaten
back to normal pace on middle and leg, Maxwell clips it away to to long leg

with him bowling slower balls third man was in and the straight fielders were back. The problem here was Sran's slower ball was short and wide and Bailey simply tucked in with a cut shot over the infield
good length ball on middle and leg, nudged into the midwicket region

almost! Bailey prefers to stay beside the ball, which pitches on a good length and holds its line. No luck with the edge, worse luck with the off stump, all it eventually hits is Dhoni's gloves and it sounds so hollow as India's hopes slip
neat little nudge through the midiwcket region. There's only on man up in the circle at that region
picks up the short ball early enough to pull it miles in front of square. Manish Pandey is the man running across from midwicket and needs to put in the full-length dive
just back of a length on off stump, Maxwell gets in line with it and blocks. Once that's done he jogs the single as the ball meanders to long-on
fullish on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg and they pinch a second.

sees the width, uses it to his advantage as he finds a single to deep third man. Keeping up with the required rate just by running their runs. Must be demoralising for a fielding team especially after putting up 300-plus
flighted outside off, driven to long-off
round-armed dart on middle and leg, cut away strongly to deep point
a grunt from Jadeja as he pushes a good length ball on middle, defended
down the track and drives the fuller ball on off stump to long-off
did that get a little boot from Maxwell? Yep. Fired into the pads, goes for the standing swipe to long leg but it is too quick for him
101 kph, on middle and leg, picked away behind square leg

excellent work from Jadeja at point. India are still trying. It shows in the batsman trying to cramp the batsman up, it shows in this big dive to his right as Jaddu stops a possible second run. But this is such a lovely batting deck. Just skims onto the bat with no sideways movement
patted into the covers as ishant goes for middle and leg and gets it to rise towards his thighs.
full and down leg, that's almost predictable considering India trying to stymie the runscoring by denying width
Pandey signals it was four, but the way Bailey picked up that length ball and sent it soaring, I thought it was 12. Brilliant ball-striking.
Jadeja tracks it over his head, he is running back as hard as he could, sticks out a hand in desperation but the outside edge off a cramped up cut shot beats him.
backs away, but Ishant follows him with a short ball, pulled to wide long-on
perhaps he was preempting Maxwell making room, because that's just a shocker of a slower ball down leg. Ishant's eighth wide of the day
short of a length and outside off, clipped through midwicket with a gentle roll of the wrists
short ball, swivel pulled to long leg
109 kph offcutter just outside off, dabbed to short third man and they trot over for a single. Possible sign that India have given up because there should be no run there
full toss, wide outside off, Maxwell looks to beat Ishant at short third man for his first boundary of the day, but he is unable to do so
goes for the short ball outside off, pulled to deep square leg
126 kph, stays inside the line and looks to punch a short of a length delivery through the covers. No contact
that's a 95 kph slower ball, Maxwell moves inside the line to lift it over the wicketkeeper. There is not enough pace to pull it off
inside edge to a 140 kph delivery just outside off, Bailey was all set for bash it through the covers. Has to settle for a single to Dhoni
full on middle and leg, Maxwell slaps it down the ground and gets a couple. Meanwhile, 300 up for the fourth time in four innings this series

full and outside off, Maxwell plants his back leg outside off and simply swings as hard as he could. So whilst he gets elevation, he has very little power. But massive luck as he splits three men tracking the skier down
backs away to clatter a 142 kph short ball way outside off down the ground. Spectacularly beaten
there is his first of the match, and scores are level. It's a short ball, Maxi camps back and pummels it wide of long-on

patted to point, straight to Jaddu, would have been out had he hit the stumps, but he does not and Bailey gets across for an unbeaten fifty and the Australian win. That's the best chase at the Gabba as well, with an over to spare and nearly no doubt about the result.
